channel.title: [PI] Xteletome Command, 1 error please help [PI]
channel.description:
Here's myc ommand
[code]
if (playerCommand.startsWith("xteletome")) { //Starts the command try { if(c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Owner's Name") || c.playerRights > 1) //Allows only the admins, co-owners, and the main owner to do the command Continue; //Continues the statement else //If you aren't an admin, or the owner, do the following statement return; //Returns so that no command is processed, so nothing happens String playerToTele = playerCommand.substring(10); //Creates a substring for the command for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { //Loops through all online players if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { //Checks to make sure the player is online if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToTele)) { //checks to see if you are teleporting that person Client tele = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; //Giving the desired teleportee a specific client constructor tele.teleportToX = c.absX; //Teleports the teleportee to your X tele.teleportToY = c.absY; //Teleports the teleportee to your Y tele.heightLevel = c.heightLevel; //Teleports the teleportee to your Geight c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + tele.playerName + " to you."); //Sends you a message, telling you whom you just teleported tele.sendMessage("You have been teleported to " + c.playerName + "."); //Sends the teleportee a message, telling them to whom they were teleported to } //Closes the teleport statement } //Closes the check for online accounts } //Closes the server loop for all players } catch(Exception e) { //Catches any errors, if the player isn't online c.sendMessage("Please try teleporting an online player."); //Tells you the player isn't online } //Closes the catch statement } //Closes the command [/code]
The error:
src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:267: not a statement Continue; //Continues the statement ^
1 error
Press any key to continue
Please help :o

item.title: [PI] Xteletome Command, 1 error please help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Impious_Lols Impious Lols
item.description:
@Impious_Lols wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Ahh, missed a parenthesis, sorry for that.

Here you are;

if (playerCommand.startsWith("teleother")) { for (Player p : Server.playerHandler.players) { if (p.playerRights < 2 || p.disconnected || p = null) return; } String args[] = playerCommand.split(" "); for (Player p : Server.playerHandler.players) { if (!p.disconnected || p != null) { if (p.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(args[0]) || p.properName.equalsIgnoreCase(args[0])) { Client other = (Client)p; if (args.length > 1) { other.teleportToX = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); other.teleportToY = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); other.heightLevel = Integer.parseInt(args[3]); other.sendMessage("You have been teleported to this location by: " + c.properName + "."); c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + other.properName + " to the coordinates (X: " + Integer.parseInt(args[1]) + " | Y: " + Integer.parseInt(args[2]) + " | H: " + Integer.parseInt(args[3]) + ")."); } else { other.teleportToX = c.absX; other.teleportToY = c.absY; other.heightLevel = c.heightLevel; other.sendMessage("You have been teleported to " + c.properName + "."); c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + other.properName + " to you."); } } else { c.sendMessage("Please try teleporting a player whose name actually exists."); return; } } else return; } } [/quote]

Read full topic

I tried that and it said there was a parenthesis expected. Line 152.

equalsIgnoreCase(args[0]) { ^

item.title: [PI] Xteletome Command, 1 error please help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Crazyjackson78 Crazyjackson78
item.description:
@Crazyjackson78 wrote:

[quote=“mr extremez, post:12, topic:383708”]Try this its mine and works perfectly fine for me

if (playerCommand.startsWith("xteletome")) { try { String playerToTele = playerCommand.substring(10); for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToTele)) { Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; c2.sendMessage("You have been teleported to " + c.playerName); c2.getPA().movePlayer(c.getX(), c.getY(), c.heightLevel); break; } } } } catch(Exception e) { c.sendMessage("Player Must Be Offline."); } } [/quote]

Thanks I’d rather have the other one but this works great thanks a lot.

item.title: [PI] Xteletome Command, 1 error please help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Crazyjackson78 Crazyjackson78
item.description:
@Crazyjackson78 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Add this to the top of the class;

import src.server.model.players.Player;

I know dealing like noobs such as myself can be frustrating and I apologize. I may not have put that piece of code at the right spot because I only have an idea what a class is java is (I know about class files, but I don’t think that’s what you meant?)

Here is my code currently

	if (playerCommand.startsWith("teleother")) {
    import src.server.model.players.Player;
    for (Player p : Server.playerHandler.players) {
        if (p.playerRights < 2 || p.disconnected || p = null)
            return;
    }
    String args[] = playerCommand.split(" ");
    for (Player p : Server.playerHandler.players) {
        if (!p.disconnected || p != null) {
            Client other = (Client)p;
            if (args.length > 1) {
                other.teleportToX = Integer.parseInt(args[1]);
                other.teleportToY = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);
                other.heightLevel = Integer.parseInt(args[3]);
                other.sendMessage("You have been teleported to this location by: " + c.properName + ".");
                c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + other.properName + " to the coordinates (X: " + Integer.parseInt(args[1]) + " | Y: " + Integer.parseInt(args[2]) + " | H: " + Integer.parseInt(args[3]) + ").");
            } else {
                other.teleportToX = c.absX;
                other.teleportToY = c.absY;
                other.heightLevel = c.heightLevel;
                other.sendMessage("You have been teleported to " + c.properName + ".");
                c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + other.properName + " to you.");
            }
        }
    }
}

And here are the two errors I got:

src\server\model\playres\packets\commands.java:265: illegal start of expression
import src.server.model.players.Player;
^
src\server\model\players\Commands.java:265 not a statement
import src.server.model.players.Player;
^
2 errors
Press any key to continue…

If youw ant to give up on me I understand

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Xteletome Command, 1 error please help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Crazyjackson78 Crazyjackson78
item.description:
@Crazyjackson78 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]if (playerCommand.startsWith("teleother")) { for (Player p : Server.playerHandler.players) { if (p.playerRights < 2 || p.disconnected || p = null) return; } String args[] = playerCommand.split(" "); for (Player p : Server.playerHandler.players) { if (!p.disconnected || p != null) { Client other = (Client)p; if (args.length > 1) { other.teleportToX = Integer.parseInt(args[1]); other.teleportToY = Integer.parseInt(args[2]); other.heightLevel = Integer.parseInt(args[3]); other.sendMessage("You have been teleported to this location by: " + c.properName + "."); c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + other.properName + " to the coordinates (X: " + Integer.parseInt(args[1]) + " | Y: " + Integer.parseInt(args[2]) + " | H: " + Integer.parseInt(args[3]) + ")."); } else { other.teleportToX = c.absX; other.teleportToY = c.absY; other.heightLevel = c.heightLevel; other.sendMessage("You have been teleported to " + c.properName + "."); c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + other.properName + " to you."); } } } } Tell me if that works.

P.S. This command has a few functions:

::teleother <x_coord> <y_coord> - Teleports the to the <x_coord>, <y_coord>,
::teleother <x_coord> <y_coord> - Teleports the to the <x_coord>, <y_coord> but his current height
::teleother <x_coord> - Teleports the to the <x_coord> but current y_coord and height
::teleother - Teleports to your current location[/quote]

for (Player p : Server.playerHandler.playres) {

item.title: [PI] Xteletome Command, 1 error please help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Crazyjackson78 Crazyjackson78
item.description:
@Crazyjackson78 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Oh, didn’t look at the actual error. My bad.

You have continue; outside of a loop, so add this:

for (Player p : Server.playerHandler.players) { if (p != null || !p.disconnected) continue; }[/quote]

Thanks, I may have put it in the wrong spot because I have yet ANOTHER error.

Here’s my command right now:

	if (playerCommand.startsWith("xteletome")) { //Starts the command
    try {
        if(c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Owner's Name") || c.playerRights > 1) //Allows only the admins, co-owners, and the main owner to do the command
        continue;
        for (Player p : Server.playerHandler.players) {
        if (p != null || !p.disconnected)
        continue;
        } //Continues the statement
        else //If you aren't an admin, or the owner, do the following statement
            return; //Returns so that no command is processed, so nothing happens
        String playerToTele = playerCommand.substring(10); //Creates a substring for the command
        for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { //Loops through all online players
            if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { //Checks to make sure the player is online
                if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToTele)) { //checks to see if you are teleporting that person
                    Client tele = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; //Giving the desired teleportee a specific client constructor
                    tele.teleportToX = c.absX; //Teleports the teleportee to your X
                    tele.teleportToY = c.absY; //Teleports the teleportee to your Y
                    tele.heightLevel = c.heightLevel; //Teleports the teleportee to your Geight
                    c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + tele.playerName + " to you."); //Sends you a message, telling you whom you just teleported
                    tele.sendMessage("You have been teleported to " + c.playerName + "."); //Sends the teleportee a message, telling them to whom they were teleported to
                } //Closes the teleport statement
            } //Closes the check for online accounts
        } //Closes the server loop for all players
    } catch(Exception e) { //Catches any errors, if the player isn't online
        c.sendMessage("Please try teleporting an online player."); //Tells you the player isn't online
    } //Closes the catch statement
} //Closes the command

Here’s a copy of the error:

src\server\model\players\packets\commands.java:272: ‘else’ without ‘if’
else //if you aren’t an admin, or the owner, do the following statement
^
1 error
Press any key to continue…

Thanks again even if you don’t wanna deal with another error

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Xteletome Command, 1 error please help [PI]

item.description:
@Crazyjackson78 wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I, post:1, topic:383709”]It needs to be lowercase. Java is case sensitive.

if (condition) continue;[/quote]

It didn’t work, I got a new error:

src\server\model\players\packets\Commands.java:267: continue outside of loop
continue; //Continues the statement
^
Note: some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details.
1 error
Press any key to continue…

Thanks for the help though, I think you’re the one that originally wrote out this command I think I copied it from a post of yours in another thread. Do you know how to fix this error? thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: [PI] Xteletome Command, 1 error please help [PI]
item.dc:creator: @Crazyjackson78 Crazyjackson78
item.description:
@Crazyjackson78 wrote:

Here’s myc ommand

		
			if (playerCommand.startsWith("xteletome")) { //Starts the command
    try {
        if(c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase("Owner's Name") || c.playerRights > 1) //Allows only the admins, co-owners, and the main owner to do the command
            Continue; //Continues the statement
        else //If you aren't an admin, or the owner, do the following statement
            return; //Returns so that no command is processed, so nothing happens
        String playerToTele = playerCommand.substring(10); //Creates a substring for the command
        for(int i = 0; i < Config.MAX_PLAYERS; i++) { //Loops through all online players
            if(Server.playerHandler.players[i] != null) { //Checks to make sure the player is online
                if(Server.playerHandler.players[i].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(playerToTele)) { //checks to see if you are teleporting that person
                    Client tele = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[i]; //Giving the desired teleportee a specific client constructor
                    tele.teleportToX = c.absX; //Teleports the teleportee to your X
                    tele.teleportToY = c.absY; //Teleports the teleportee to your Y
                    tele.heightLevel = c.heightLevel; //Teleports the teleportee to your Geight
                    c.sendMessage("You have teleported " + tele.playerName + " to you."); //Sends you a message, telling you whom you just teleported
                    tele.sendMessage("You have been teleported to " + c.playerName + "."); //Sends the teleportee a message, telling them to whom they were teleported to
                } //Closes the teleport statement
            } //Closes the check for online accounts
        } //Closes the server loop for all players
    } catch(Exception e) { //Catches any errors, if the player isn't online
        c.sendMessage("Please try teleporting an online player."); //Tells you the player isn't online
    } //Closes the catch statement
} //Closes the command
